inclusion.criterion: Prior surgery for degenerative mitral regurgitation (DMR) at Northwestern Memorial
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Hospital performed by a single surgeon.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Mitral Valve surgery performed > 6 months and <36 months at the time of consent.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Concomitant procedures at time of index procedure may include incidental CAB, MAZE and tricuspid valve surgery.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: STS (Society of Thoracic Surgeons) mortality risk score of ≥ 2 and < 6 for mitral valve repair or ≥ 2 and < 8 for mitral valve replacement at time of index procedure.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Able to speak, read, and understand English
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Pre-operative tricuspid regurgitation of 4+ (severe) at time of index procedure.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Contraindication to exercise testing (i.e., Uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmias causing symptoms or hemodynamic compromise, symptomatic severe aortic stenosis, uncontrolled symptomatic heart failure, etc.).
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Unable to perform an exercise test due to clinical criteria such oxygen dependency, neuromuscular limitations, NYHA class 4, unstable angina, and postural hypotension.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Surgical or interventional cardiac procedure or other intervention since the index procedure that in the opinion of the Investigator may confound data analysis.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Subjects unwilling or unable to give written informed consent.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has Marfan's syndrome and known severe mitral valve prolapse with regurgitation, but remains symptomatic and is now prepared to undergo mitral valve repair/replacement surgery.
